newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan 97/98 real GDP growth forecast at 1.9%--EPA.
newsitem.headline: Japan 97/98 real GDP growth forecast at 1.9%--EPA.

text.p: The Japanese government is expecting real gross domestic product growth for the 1997/98 fiscal year of about 1.9 percent in real terms, Economic Planning Agency Minister Taro Aso told reporters on Wednesday.
The government has kept its official forecast of 2.5 percent GDP growth for the current fiscal year.
"Economic growth may slow in the first half of 1997/98 due to an increase in the consumption tax, but Japan can achieve sustainable economic recovery in the whole fiscal year," Aso said.
The following are the official forecasts released by the EPA on Wednesday:
C/A surplus 6.9 trln yen 7.0 trln yen 9.7 trln yen
Note: Figures are approximate. More details and exact forecasts will be released at an extraordinary cabinet meeting on Thursday.
A senior EPA official said the government will likely forecast private consumption growth of 1.5 percent for the fiscal year starting from April 1.
He added that private housing spending would likely be forecast to fall by about five percent while capital spending would likely be forecast to grow about 7.0 percent.
The forecasts were drafted on an assumption of an average exchange rate of 112.74 yen to the dollar, the average for the past month, the official said.
A rate of 110.49 yen to the dollar was used when making the forecasts for the current fiscal year.
